snippet: Proponents say there are valid reasons besides terminal illness to choose to die, among them loss of independence, deterioration and loneliness....
abstract: Dutch lawmakers propose measure allowing elderly people who are not facing imminent death to choose assisted suicide; proposed law, which follows 2001 legalization of euthanasia in Netherlands for terminally ill patients, draws fire from politicians and Christian groups.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and CHRISTOPHER F. SCHUETZE
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from London, and Christopher F. Schuetze from The Hague.

lead_paragraph: Proponents say there are valid reasons besides terminal illness to choose to die, among them loss of independence, deterioration and loneliness.

headline.main: Dutch Law Would Allow Assisted Suicide for Healthy Older People
headline.print_headline: Dutch Law Would Let Healthy Older People Choose Death
